definitions.definition: to such a great extent.
examples: the words tumbled out so fast that I could barely hear them

definitions.definition: extremely; very much (used for emphasis).
examples: she looked so pretty

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a clause or negative statement.
examples: that's so not fair

definitions.definition: used with a gesture to indicate size.
examples: the bird was about so long

definitions.definition: to the same extent (used in comparisons).
examples: he isn't so bad as you'd think

definitions.definition: referring back to something previously mentioned.
that is the case.
examples: “Is it going to rain?” “I think so.”

definitions.definition: the truth.
examples: I hear that you're a writer—is that so?

definitions.definition: similarly; and also.
examples: times have changed and so have I

definitions.definition: expressing agreement.
examples: “It's cold in here.” “So it is.”

definitions.definition: used to emphatically contradict a negative statement.
examples: it is so!

definitions.definition: in the way described or demonstrated; thus.
examples: hold your arms so

definitions.definition: and for this reason; therefore.
examples: it was still painful, so I went to see a specialist

definitions.definition: with the result that.
examples: it was overgrown with brambles, so that I had difficulty making any progress

definitions.definition: with the aim that; in order that.
examples: they whisper to each other so that no one else can hear

definitions.definition: and then; as the next step.
examples: and so to the finals

definitions.definition: introducing a question.
examples: so, what did you do today?

definitions.definition: introducing a question following on from what was said previously.
examples: so what did he do about it?

definitions.definition: why should that be considered significant?
examples: “Marv is wearing a suit.” “So?”

definitions.definition: introducing a statement that is followed by a defensive comment.
examples: so I like anchovies—what's wrong with that?

definitions.definition: introducing a concluding statement.
examples: so that's that

definitions.definition: in the same way; correspondingly.
examples: just as bad money drives out good, so does bad art drive out the good
